text.headline: Early Human Societies
text.text: The period from 10,000 BCE to 500 CE, covering the development of early human societies and gender roles.

text.headline: Tool Use and Bipedalism
text.text: The development and use of tools significantly influenced human evolution and gender-specific tasks. The evolution of bipedalism had significant implications for the division of labor between genders in early human societies.

text.headline: Neanderthal Division of Labor
text.text: Archaeological evidence from Neanderthal sites provides insights into the gendered division of labor in these early human relatives.

text.headline: Parental Investment Theory and Reproductive Strategies
text.text: Parental investment theory explains differences in male and female reproductive strategies based on the relative investment each sex makes in offspring.
